content.title: Planck Scale vs Atomic Scale: The Role of α
content.abstract: A systematic comparison of Planck scales to atomic scales, revealing how the fine structure constant α ≈ 1/137 determines the enormous gap between quantum gravity and atomic physics. Understanding this hierarchy illuminates why gravity is irrelevant at atomic scales.

comparison_overview.planck_domain: Quantum gravity effects dominate; spacetime structure uncertain
comparison_overview.atomic_domain: Quantum mechanics + electromagnetic forces; gravity negligible
comparison_overview.gap: ~25 orders of magnitude in length; ~45 orders of magnitude in force

bohr_radius.symbol: a_0 = ℏ/(m_e c α) = ℓ_P/(α² × m_e/m_P)

ratio_bohr_to_planck.interpretation: Atoms are 10²⁵ times larger than Planck scale!

ratio_planck_to_rydberg.interpretation: Planck energy is 10²⁸ times atomic binding!

ratio.interpretation: Electromagnetism is 10⁴⁰ times stronger than gravity in atoms!

why_alpha_matters: α determines strength of electromagnetic binding: E_bind ~ α² m_e c²
α determines atomic size: a_0 ~ 1/α relative to Compton wavelength
α connects QED to atomic physics—same constant everywhere
If α were larger, atoms would be smaller and more tightly bound

hierarchy_formula.statement: The ratio of atomic to Planck scales is (m_P/m_e)/α ≈ 10²⁵
hierarchy_formula.decomposition: = (10²²) × (137) where 10²² is mass hierarchy, 137 is EM strength
hierarchy_formula.implication: Most of the gap comes from mass hierarchy, not α

physical_implications.consequence: Can ignore gravity in chemistry and molecular physics

physical_implications.implication: Atomic physics is far from quantum gravity
physical_implications.reason: E_atom/E_P ~ 10⁻²⁸; atomic energies never probe Planck scale
physical_implications.consequence: QED and atomic physics don't need quantum gravity corrections

physical_implications.implication: Fine structure constant links all electromagnetic scales
physical_implications.reason: α appears in every ratio: binding/rest, Bohr/Compton, etc.
physical_implications.consequence: If α changed, all atomic physics would change proportionally

physical_implications.implication: Mass hierarchy m_P/m_e dominates scale separation
physical_implications.reason: Even if α = 1, atoms would still be 10²² times larger than ℓ_P
physical_implications.consequence: The electron mass (why so light?) is the deep mystery

Understand role of α in connecting scales
Explain why gravity is negligible at atomic scales
Identify the mass hierarchy as primary source of scale separation
